snippet: President Vladimir V. Putin’s inner circle is said to believe that Russia had not benefited much from Mr. Obama’s “reset” policy.
abstract: Many foreign policy experts on both sides are bewildered by announcement that Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin will not attend Group of 8 summit, avoiding the chance to meet with Pres Obama; many irritants exist between the countries, although the change of plans comes as officials from Russia and the US signal that they are prepared for relations to normalize.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER, STEVEN LEE MYERS and ELLEN BARRY
byline.contributor: Helene Cooper and Steven Lee Myers reported from Washington, and Ellen Barry from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: President Vladimir V. Putin’s inner circle is said to believe that Russia had not benefited much from Mr. Obama’s “reset” policy.

headline.seo: Analysts Seek Political Import as Putin Puts Off Meeting Obama
headline.main: As Putin Postpones Meeting Obama, Analysts Seek Political Import
headline.print_headline: As Putin Postpones Meeting Obama, Analysts Seek Political Import
